contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox stadium | stadium_name = Yuvileiny Stadium | nickname = | image = [[File:Yuvileiny Stadium (Sumy).jpg|350px]] | caption = | location = [[Ukraine]] 40030, [[Sumy]], vulytsia Haharina 9 | coordinates = {{coord|50|54|8|N|34|47|59|E|type:landmark|display=inline}} | broke_ground = September 2, 1999 | opened = September 20, 2001 | renovated = | expanded = | closed = | demolished = | owner = Public joint-stock company "Spartak" (2001–2007) <br> city of [[Sumy]] (2007-present) | operator = city of [[Sumy]] | surface = Grass | scoreboard = 3.69 X 5.94 (m) "[[Videoton (company)|Videoton]]" {{flagicon|Hungary}} | construction_cost = [[Hryvnia|₴]] 50,000,000+ | architect = ? | project_manager = Public joint-stock company "Spartak" | structural engineer = "Tsivilproektrestavratsia" ("Ukraniiproektrekonstruktsia") | services engineer = "Stroimashservis" (groundwork) | general_contractor = PPKMP "NASA" | main_contractors = "Sumykhimprom" (southern stand)<br>"Agropromstroi" (eastern stand)<br>"Sumy machine-building Frunze Production Complex" (northern stand) | former_names = | tenants = [[FC Spartak Sumy]] (2001 - 2007)<br>[[FC Kharkiv]] (2008 - 2009)<br>[[Ukrainian Super Cup]] (2009)<br>[[FC Sumy|PFC Sumy]] (2009 - present) | seating_capacity = 30 000 ([[football (soccer)|football]]) | record_attendance = 29300 [[FC Spartak Sumy|Spartak]] - [[FC Naftovyk Okhtyrka|Naftovyk]]<ref>[http://www.dynamomania.com/news/43613-ustanovlen-rekord-poseschaemosti-ukrainskoy-pervoy-ligi Установлен рекорд посещаемости украинской первой лиги]</ref> <br> [[Ukrainian First League 2002-03]] | dimensions = 105 X 68 sq. m | website = [http://fc.sumy.ua/news/2008-09-28-9 fc.sumy.ua] }} '''Stadion Yuvileiny''' ({{lang-ua|Стадiон Ювiлейний}}, {{lang-ru|Стадион Юбилейный}} '''Stadion Yubilejny''') is a [[football (soccer)|football]]-only [[stadium]] located at 9 Gagarin street, [[Sumy]], [[Ukraine]] 40030. The stadium comprises an area of {{convert|5.1782|ha|acre}}. Stadion Yuvileiny is currently used mostly for [[football (soccer)|football]] matches, and is the previous home of the now-defunct [[FC Spartak Sumy]]. The ownership of the stadium currently belongs to the city after the partnership owning Spartak went into bankruptcy. The stadium holds 25,830 people and was built in 2001. [[FC Kharkiv]], from the [[Ukrainian Premier League]] leased the stadium for the 2008-09 season. ==History== The stadium broke ground in late 1999 and in two years was opened. Originally it was constructed for the Spartak Sumy that at that time competed in the [[Ukrainian First League]] with the perspective for the club advancing to the national premiers. According to the official website of PFC Sumy the rate of the stadium's construction was never seen before: "расчетных темпов строительства не знало до сих пор еще ни одно строение". The website also claims that work was conducted without breaks for holidays. The financial support for the construction was given from such big Ukrainian companies as [[Naftogaz Ukrainy]] with its "[[Ukrnafta]]" and the regional representative in the face of "Okhtyrkanaftogaz". The territory of the stadium is {{convert|1|ha|acre}}, while the constructed territory rounds to {{convert|15960|m2|sqft}}. The drainage system and the field-heating system was installed by "Eleter" ([[Kiev]]), while the stadium lighting is ensured by "Vatra". The administrative building is 106.4 м by 14.9 м, while the training hall is {{convert|164.2|m2|sqft}}. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.meria.sumy.ua/ua/sumy/sport/sport_buildings/stadium_uvileyniy Link to the information about the stadium on the web-site of the Sumy City Council.] * [http://fc.sumy.ua/news/2008-09-28-9 Stadium information at the official website of PFC Sumy] {{Venues of Ukrainian PL}} [[Category:Football venues in Ukraine]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Sumy Oblast]] [[Category:Sport in Sumy]] {{Ukraine-sports-venue-stub}}
